src:
- Bayern München jakter Wenger
Bayern München skal ha Arsène Wenger øverst på ønskelista som ny trener etter at Nico Kovac fikk sparken nylig.
06 Nov 2019, 12:40 by Christian Grieg Sander
Det melder The Guardian sammen med en rekke andre storaviser.
Franskmannen har vært uten trenerjobb etter han forlot Arsenal i 2018. Nå ryktes han sterkt til Tysklands mest meriterte klubb.
Het kandidat
Selv om Wenger har stått uten trenerjobb etter han var ferdig i Arsenal, har han jobbet tett med fotball som ekspert for ulike kanaler. Han har uttalt flere ganger at han kunne tenkt seg tilbake i treneryrket.

Nico Kovac fikk sparken etter stortapet mot Eintracht Frankfurt nå i helga. Nå er Bayern München på jakt etter en erstatter, og Wenger nevnes som en høyaktuell kandidat.

Kovac ledet laget til gull i fjor, men klarte ikke å følge opp de gode resultatene i år. Bayern München ligger på en fjerdeplass så langt med 18 poeng.
Vil forhandle
Ifølge The Guardian vil Bayern gå i forhandlinger med Wenger denne uka.

De skal angivelig være villig til å gi ham en kontrakt ut sesongen. Videre står det at storklubben neste sesong vil prøve seg på Ajax-trener Erik Ten Haag eller PSG-trener Thomas Tuchel som en permanent løsning.

Wenger har uttalt i et intervju at han har lyst til å komme tilbake i treneryrket, og at Bayern München kan bli aktuelt for franskmannen.
text:
- Bayern Munich are chasing Wenger
Bayern Munich will have Arsène Wenger at the top of their wish list as a new coach after Nico Kovac was fired recently.
06 Nov 2019, 12:40 by Christian Grieg Sander
This is reported by The Guardian along with a number of other major newspapers.
The Frenchman has been without a coaching job since leaving Arsenal in 2018. Now he is strongly rumored to be Germany's most merited club.
Hot candidate
Although Wenger has been without a coaching job since he finished at Arsenal, he has worked closely with football as an expert on various channels. He has stated several times that he could think back in the training profession.

Nico Kovac got fired after the big loss against Eintracht Frankfurt this weekend. Now Bayern Munich are looking for a replacement, and Wenger is named as a topical candidate.

Kovac led the team to gold last year, but failed to follow up on the good results this year. Bayern Munich is in fourth place so far with 18 points.
Will negotiate
According to The Guardian, Bayern will negotiate with Wenger this week.

They must be willing to give him a contract out of season. Furthermore, it is said that the big club next season will try on Ajax coach Erik Ten Haag or PSG coach Thomas Tuchel as a permanent solution.

Wenger has said in an interview that he wants to get back into the training profession and that Bayern Munich may be relevant for the Frenchman.
